abstract.text: A special type of layout object that lets you implement behaviors when changing from one layout to another in your collection view.

legalNotices.copyright: Copyright © 2025 Apple Inc. All rights reserved.

inlineContent.text: as-is or subclass it to provide specialized behavior for your app. A common use for transition layouts is to create interactive transitions, such as those that are driven by gesture recognizers or touch events.

During a layout change, the collection view installs this layout object temporarily to manage the changeover. This layout object determines the layout of each item by interpolating between the layout values in the current and new layout objects. The interpolation is driven by the value in the

property, which you update periodically from your code to drive the transition. For example, if you use this class in conjunction with a gesture recognizer, the handler for your gesture recognizer would update that property and invalidate the layout.

If you want to provide more than just a linear transition from the old to new layout over time, you need to subclass and provide the layout attributes for items yourself. Subclassing requires you to override all of the same methods you would override when subclassing

. The difference is that your custom methods can work with your gesture recognizers or touch event code to change the layout based on input from the user. For example, you could use a custom layout object in conjunction with a gesture recognizer to make items track the location of the user’s finger on the screen. You also need to implement the
method of your collection view delegate and return your custom layout object when asked for it.

abstract.text: Construct and manage a graphical, event-driven user interface for your iOS, iPadOS, or tvOS app.
Asks for the custom transition layout to use when moving between the specified layouts.
A layout object that organizes items into a grid with optional header and footer views for each section.
A set of properties for determining whether to recompute the size of items or their position in the layout.
An abstract base class for generating layout information for a collection view.
A layout object that manages the layout-related attributes for a given item in a collection view.
A special type of layout object that lets you implement behaviors when changing from one layout to another in your collection view.
The collection view’s current layout object.
Creates a transition layout object from data in an unarchiver.
Initializes and returns a transition layout object.
The collection view’s new layout object.
The completion percentage of the transition.
Sets the value for an animatable key.
Returns the most recently set value for the specified key.
Customize a view layout by changing the size of cells in the flow or implementing a mosaic style.
A protocol that enables an object to be encoded and decoded for archiving and distribution.
The group of methods that are fundamental to all Objective-C objects.
A type that can be hashed into a `Hasher` to produce an integer hash value.
A type that can be compared for value equality.
A singleton actor whose executor is equivalent to the main dispatch queue.
A type with a customized textual representation.
A type with a customized textual representation suitable for debugging purposes.
A type whose instances can be encoded, and appropriately passed, as elements of a C `va_list`.
A thread-safe type whose values can be shared across arbitrary concurrent contexts without introducing a risk of data races.
